info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Albany, north central Greene and southeastern Schoharie Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 1012 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Livingstonville, or 17 miles southeast of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Livingstonville, Preston-Potter Hollow, Preston Hollow, Durham, Rensselaerville, Shoefelt Corners, West Berne, Huntersland, Manorkill, Broome Center, Smith Corner, Five Corners, Lambs Corner, Oak Hill, Zucks Corners, Snyders Corners, Cooksburg, West Durham, Bates and South Berne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
